contents.content: Bowler is super simple to use. Just include jQuery, Handlebars and the Bowler.js file then...
Extend will extend the model and overwrite any previously written values.
Render will place vaiables into a Mustache template and store the template as well
Bind will bind our template to a element on the page.
This script will bind our template to the body and now when ever our model is updated it will update the view bound to the body.
Whats the use of only having one model. Bowler supports child models.
var page = app.Model('page', { world: "universe" }); var pageView = app.View('page', "<b>{{universe}}</b>"); //changing the main models template app.render("<h1>{{title}}{{{child 'page'}}}</h1>");
